comments.body: We have no guarantee these props will be available in the future versions of React-Calendar; for now I think this might be fine, but still we would need to import this package here...?

If the current version uses all props from calendar then we should re-use their interface. In the future, this package needs to be updated if the dependency is removed. Or else your documentation "DateTimeRangePicker component passes all props to React-Calendar, with the exception of className" is invalid and typescript users won't be able to add those props to the component.
Missing className. Well, it is there, but for future-proofing without reliance on CalendarProps I think this should be added.
Adding className, didn't read about the calendarClassName. So it makes sense it's there.
